callouts: For best results, use high-resolution images for your brand assets to ensure they appear crisp and professional on the kiosk display.
Always preview your branding changes on a test kiosk before deploying to a live environment to check for layout and formatting issues.

paragraphs: You have now learned how to use the kiosk branding tool to customize your device's interface. By defining a content brief, uploading assets, selecting a template, and adjusting generation parameters, you can create a unique and engaging user experience that reflects your brand identity.

faq.answer: The 'Content Brief' section is where you define the primary text-based messaging for your kiosk. This could be a welcome message, brand tagline, or instructions. It has a 1000-character limit.
faq.question: What is the purpose of the 'Content Brief' section?

faq.answer: Yes, you can upload brand assets like logos using the 'Attach File' section. You can either drag and drop the file or use the 'Browse Files' button. Ensure your file is in PDF or DOCX format and under 10MB.
faq.question: Can I upload my company logo?

faq.answer: These are 'Premium' generation parameters that control the application of your brand. 'Detail Level' (Low, Medium, High) likely adjusts the complexity of the visual theme, while 'Formality Level' (None, Formal, Neutral) sets the tone of voice for any system-generated text on the kiosk.
faq.question: What do the 'Detail Level' and 'Formality Level' parameters do?

faq.answer: You can choose from a list of pre-defined layouts using the 'Select Template' dropdown. For fully custom layouts, please consult our advanced documentation or contact support.
faq.question: Is it possible to use a custom layout for my kiosk?

features: Define a core brand message or identity in the 'Content Brief' section.
Upload brand assets such as logos and background images using the 'Attach File' feature.
Choose from various pre-designed kiosk layouts with the 'Select Template' option.
Link dynamic content that aligns with your brand using 'Select Sources'.
Fine-tune the application of your brand with 'Generation Parameters' like Detail and Formality Level.
Use the 'Capture Screen' tool to select brand colors or inspiration.

introduction.audience: Administrators or marketing personnel responsible for managing the kiosk's brand identity.
introduction.purpose: This guide explains how to use the branding configuration tool to customize the visual appearance and messaging of your kiosk.
introduction.scope: This document covers all available settings for kiosk branding, including uploading assets, selecting templates, and defining generation parameters. It does not cover the creation of brand assets themselves.
outcomes: Understand the different branding customization options.
Be able to upload brand assets like logos and images.
Configure the kiosk's visual theme and layout.
Apply a specific tone and style to the kiosk's messaging.
prerequisites: Administrative access to the kiosk management portal.
Prepared brand assets (e.g., logo, images, color palette information).

notes: The 'Generation Parameters' are marked as a 'Premium' feature and may require an upgraded subscription to access.

shortDescription: Learn how to configure and apply your unique brand identity to your kiosk interface using our comprehensive branding tool.

steps.explanation: This is the primary input for the text that will be displayed on your kiosk.
steps.step: Locate the 'Content Brief' section at the top of the configuration page.

steps.explanation: Replace the placeholder text 'Describe your document requirements...' with your own content. This could be a welcome message, a tagline, or instructions for the user.
steps.step: Click inside the text box and enter your brand's core message.

steps.explanation: The counter, which appears as '0/1000', updates as you type. This ensures your message stays within the 1000-character limit for optimal display on the kiosk screen.
steps.step: Monitor the character counter below the text box.

steps.explanation: Drag and drop your logo or background image file into the designated area, or click 'Browse Files' to select a file from your computer.
steps.step: Upload your primary brand assets using the 'Attach File' section.

steps.explanation: Select a pre-configured template that best fits your brand's aesthetic and functional needs.
steps.step: Choose a layout for your kiosk interface from the 'Select Template' dropdown.

steps.explanation: Adjust the 'Detail Level' (Low, Medium, High) and 'Formality Level' (None, Formal, Neutral) to control how the branding elements and text are rendered on the kiosk.
steps.step: Configure the branding style using 'Generation Parameters'.
